title: Provides for the promotion and marketing of hunting and fishing in N.Y. state
summary: Provides for the promotion and marketing of hunting and fishing in NYS; requires tourist promotion agencies to publish on website information regarding hunting and fishing, and to distribute brochures and maps at local offices; provides for a fishing promotion program and a hunting promotion program.

                                         2708

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011

       Introduced  by M. of A. RABBITT -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Tourism, Parks, Arts and Sports Development

       AN ACT to amend the  economic  development  law  and  the  environmental
         conservation  law,  in relation to promoting and marketing hunting and
         fishing in New York state

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  economic  development law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 167 to read as follows:
    3    S 167. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR TOURIST PROMOTION  AGENCIES.    (A)
    4  EACH  TOURIST  PROMOTION  AGENCY, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE COMMISSIONER,
    5  SHALL MARKET AND PROMOTE NEW YORK STATE AS  A  PREMIER  DESTINATION  FOR
    6  HUNTING  AND  FISHING.  SUCH  PROMOTION  AGENCY  SHALL  MAINTAIN  ON ITS
    7  WEBSITE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
    8    (1) PUBLIC FISHING SECTIONS OF STREAMS, PONDS AND LAKES;
    9    (2) MAPS OF SUCH PUBLIC FISHING SECTIONS OF STREAMS, PONDS AND LAKES;
   10    (3) INFORMATION REGARDING TYPES OF GAME SPECIES  HUNTED  IN  NEW  YORK
   11  STATE AND REGIONS WHERE SUCH GAME ARE LOCATED;
   12    (4)  WILDLIFE  RECREATION  MAPS  INDICATING  HUNTING  AREAS LOCATED ON
   13  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE LANDS;
   14    (5) THE LOCATION OF STATE LANDS, INCLUDING  FORESTS,  PARKS,  WILDLIFE
   15  MANAGEMENT  AREAS, TRAILS, CAMPSITES BY TYPE, SKI AREAS, HATCHERIES, AND
   16  ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTERS AND CAMPS;
   17    (6) HANDICAPPED ACCESS POINTS FOR ALL SUCH WILDLIFE RECREATION  SITES,
   18  INCLUDING SUCH HUNTING AND FISHING SITES; AND
   19    (7)  LINKS  TO  THE  NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT
   20  WEBSITE.
   21    (B) EACH TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCY SHALL MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE  PUBLIC,
   22  BROCHURES  AND  MAPS REGARDING HUNTING AND FISHING IN NEW YORK STATE, AT
   23  ALL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCY LOCATIONS.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03690-01-1

       A. 2708                             2

    1    S 2. Section 11-0305 of the environmental conservation law is  amended
    2  by adding a new subdivision 19 to read as follows:
    3    19.  TO  DEVELOP A MARKETING STRATEGY, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMMIS-
    4  SIONER OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, THE  NEW  YORK  STATE  TOURISM  ADVISORY
    5  COUNCIL,  AND WITH LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCIES, TO PROMOTE NEW YORK
    6  STATE AS A PREMIER DESTINATION FOR HUNTING AND FISHING.
    7    S 3. The section heading, the opening paragraph and subdivision  3  of
    8  section 11-1307 of the environmental conservation law, as added by chap-
    9  ter  576  of  the laws of 2006, are amended and a new subdivision 3-a is
   10  added to read as follows:
   11    [Fishing] NEW YORK STATE FISHING promotion program.
   12    The commissioner shall  develop  and  implement  a  fishing  promotion
   13  program. The commissioner shall, in conjunction with the commissioner of
   14  economic development [and], THE NEW YORK STATE TOURISM ADVISORY COUNCIL,
   15  LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCIES DULY DESIGNATED PURSUANT TO SECTION ONE
   16  HUNDRED SIXTY-FOUR OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAW, AND the commissioner
   17  of  parks, recreation and historic preservation, develop and implement a
   18  MARKETING STRATEGY PURSUANT TO SUCH PROMOTION program [which will]  THAT
   19  SHALL  PROMOTE  NEW YORK STATE AS A PREMIER DESTINATION FOR FISHING, AND
   20  SHALL encourage residents and out-of-state fishermen to utilize New York
   21  state's fishing opportunities. Such program shall include,  but  not  be
   22  limited to:
   23    3.  making  available  to the [fishing] public, via both brochures and
   24  the agency's website, the following information:
   25    a. Public fishing sections of streams, ponds, and lakes;
   26    b. Public access points for streams, ponds, and lakes;
   27    c. Handicapped access points for all water bodies; [and]
   28    d. The location of state lands,  including  forests,  parks,  wildlife
   29  management  areas, trails, campsites by type, ski areas, hatcheries, and
   30  environmental education centers and camps;
   31    E. MAPS OF PUBLIC FISHING SECTIONS OF STREAMS, PONDS, AND LAKES; AND
   32    F. LINKS TO LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCY WEBSITES;
   33    3-A. MAKING AVAILABLE TO LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION  AGENCIES,  INCLUDING
   34  BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   35    A. PUBLIC FISHING SECTIONS OF STREAMS, PONDS, AND LAKES;
   36    B. PUBLIC ACCESS POINTS FOR STREAMS, PONDS, AND LAKES;
   37    C. HANDICAPPED ACCESS POINTS FOR ALL WATER BODIES;
   38    D.  THE  LOCATION  OF  STATE LANDS, INCLUDING FORESTS, PARKS, WILDLIFE
   39  MANAGEMENT AREAS, TRAILS, CAMPSITES BY TYPE, SKI AREAS, HATCHERIES,  AND
   40  ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTERS AND CAMPS; AND
   41    E. MAPS OF PUBLIC FISHING SECTIONS OF STREAMS, PONDS, AND LAKES;
   42    S  4.  The  environmental  conservation law is amended by adding a new
   43  section 11-0902 to read as follows:
   44  S 11-0902. NEW YORK STATE HUNTING PROMOTION PROGRAM.
   45    THE COMMISSIONER SHALL  DEVELOP  AND  IMPLEMENT  A  HUNTING  PROMOTION
   46  PROGRAM.    THE COMMISSIONER SHALL, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMMISSIONER
   47  OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, THE NEW YORK STATE  TOURISM  ADVISORY  COUNCIL,
   48  LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCIES DULY DESIGNATED PURSUANT TO SECTION ONE
   49  HUNDRED SIXTY-FOUR OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LAW, AND THE COMMISSIONER
   50  OF  PARKS, RECREATION AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION, DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A
   51  MARKETING STRATEGY PURSUANT TO SUCH PROMOTION PROGRAM THAT SHALL PROMOTE
   52  NEW YORK STATE AS A PREMIER DESTINATION FOR HUNTING, AND SHALL ENCOURAGE
   53  RESIDENTS AND OUT-OF-STATE HUNTSMEN AND SPORTSMEN TO  UTILIZE  NEW  YORK
   54  STATE'S  HUNTING  OPPORTUNITIES.  SUCH PROGRAM SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE
   55  LIMITED TO:

       A. 2708                             3

    1    1. WORKING WITH LOCAL SPORTSMAN CLUBS, RETAIL STORES, AND COUNTY CHAM-
    2  BERS TO DEVELOP AND CONDUCT SPORTSMAN EDUCATION CLASSES  FOR  ADULTS  TO
    3  INSTRUCT  ON  HUNTING AND TRAPPING TECHNIQUES FOR THE HUNT OF, INCLUDING
    4  BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DEER, BEAR, TURKEY, SMALL GAME,  FURBEARERS,  WATER-
    5  FOWL  AND  MIGRATORY  GAME BIRDS; AND TO PROVIDE SAFETY INFORMATION THAT
    6  WILL PROMOTE SUCCESSFUL AND SAFE HUNTING EXPERIENCES;
    7    2. CONDUCTING PUBLIC OUTREACH, INCLUDING WORKING WITH LOCAL  COMMUNITY
    8  AND  YOUTH  ORGANIZATIONS,  TOURISM PROMOTION AGENCIES AND LOCAL GOVERN-
    9  MENTS, TO DEVELOP PROGRAMS, SUCH AS EDUCATIONAL  SEMINARS,  HUNTING  AND
   10  GAMING  FESTIVALS,  AND  HUNTING  AND TRAPPING MENTORING PROGRAMS, WHICH
   11  WILL ENCOURAGE INDIVIDUALS TO TAKE UP THE SPORT OF HUNTING AND GAMING;
   12    3. MAKING AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, VIA BOTH BROCHURES AND THE AGENCY'S
   13  WEBSITE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   14    A. INFORMATION REGARDING TYPES OF GAME  SPECIES,  REGIONS  WHERE  SUCH
   15  GAME  ARE  LOCATED  AND  CURRENT POPULATION OF SUCH GAME INHABITING SUCH
   16  REGION;
   17    B. HUNTING PERMIT AND LICENSING GUIDELINES AND REGULATIONS;
   18    C. WILDLIFE RECREATION MAP INDICATING HUNTING AREAS LOCATED ON  PUBLIC
   19  AND PRIVATE LANDS;
   20    D.  THE  LOCATION  OF  STATE LANDS, INCLUDING FORESTS, PARKS, WILDLIFE
   21  MANAGEMENT AREAS, TRAILS, CAMPSITES BY TYPE, SKI AREAS, HATCHERIES,  AND
   22  ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTERS AND CAMPS;
   23    E. HANDICAPPED ACCESS POINTS FOR ALL WILDLIFE RECREATION SITES;
   24    F.  INFORMATION  REGARDING  SPORTSMAN OR HUNTSMAN EDUCATIONAL CLASSES,
   25  MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS AND TRAINING COURSES REGARDING HUNTING AND TRAPPING;
   26  AND
   27    G. LINKS TO LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCY WEBSITES;
   28    4. MAKING AVAILABLE TO LOCAL TOURIST PROMOTION AGENCIES, INCLUDING BUT
   29  NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   30    A. INFORMATION REGARDING TYPES OF GAME  SPECIES,  REGIONS  WHERE  SUCH
   31  GAME  ARE  LOCATED  AND  CURRENT POPULATION OF SUCH GAME INHABITING SUCH
   32  REGION;
   33    B. HUNTING PERMIT AND LICENSING GUIDELINES AND REGULATIONS;
   34    C. WILDLIFE RECREATION  MAP  INDICATING  HUNTING  AREAS  AVAILABLE  ON
   35  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE LANDS;
   36    D.  THE  LOCATION  OF  STATE LANDS, INCLUDING FORESTS, PARKS, WILDLIFE
   37  MANAGEMENT AREAS, TRAILS, CAMPSITES BY TYPE, SKI AREAS, HATCHERIES,  AND
   38  ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION CENTERS AND CAMPS;
   39    E. HANDICAPPED ACCESS POINTS FOR ALL WILDLIFE RECREATION SITES; AND
   40    F.  INFORMATION  REGARDING  SPORTSMAN OR HUNTSMAN EDUCATIONAL CLASSES,
   41  MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS AND TRAINING COURSES REGARDING HUNTING AND TRAPPING.
   42    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately.
